thread.title: Local roundup: Plainfield volleyball fends off Bacon in 5 games
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Plainfield volleyball fends off Bacon in 5 games

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Plainfield volleyball fends off Bacon in 5 games
text: COLCHESTER — Reese Griffin had 26 kills and four aces to help the Plainfield volleyball team edge Bacon Academy, 3-2, on Tuesday for its fourth straight victory. The Panthers won, 25-15, 25-18, 20-25, 18-25, 15-10. Kayla Rojas dished out 29 assists and Jamie Beauregard added 21 digs for Plainfield (9-5). Gabby Zumpano totaled 23 assists and seven aces for Bacon Academy (4-11). Lyman 3 Ledyard 0 LEBANON — Abby Bundy had a team-best 11 kills and the Bulldogs swept the Colonels (1-13), 25-5, 25-14, 25-20, for their 12th straight win. Katy Konow added 19 assists for Lyman (12-1). Cheney Tech 3 Grasso Tech 1 GROTON — Kiera Sebastian totaled nine assists, eight service points and four blocks, but the Eagles (3-9) fell, 25-23, 25-19, 19-25, 25-20. FIELD HOCKEY NFA 5 Waterford 0 NORWICH — Alexa Devito scored two goals and the Wildcats beat the Lancers (2-6-1, 2-6-1 Eastern Connecticut Conference). Christina Konstantinidis added a goal and two assists for NFA (4-4-2, 4-4-2). Stonington 1 East Lyme 0 STONINGTON — Brooke Arruda scored off a feed from Lauren Turner after a penalty corner to give the Bears (8-0-3, 8-0-2 ECC) a victory over the Vikings (7-2-2, 6-2-2). Killingly 4 GROTON — Alyssa Rainey scored twice to lift the Redgals to their fourth straight win. Teagan Waggoner and Katelyn Bennett also scored for Killingly (9-1-2, 8-0-2 ECC). Fitch-Ledyard fell to 0-9, 0-7. Woodstock 2 Windham 0 WILLIMANTIC — Mikayla Jones and Mariangela Riggeri scored to give the Centaurs (5-6, 5-5 ECC) the win over the Whippets (0-11, 0-9). MEN’S SOCCER ECSU 4 Fitchburg St. 0 FITCHBURG, Mass. — Waterford graduate Kevin Zeppieri scored his first collegiate goal as the Warriors cruised to victory. Xavier Doran had a goal and an assist and JD Stearns and Justin Jensen also scored for Eastern Connecticut State (11-2-1, 3-0-1 Little East). Louisville 2 UConn 1 LOUISVILLE, Ky. — Montville alum Tyler Leeman scored his second goal of the season, but the Huskies could not fend off the Cardinals. UConn (3-5-4) is winless in its last six games. FIELD HOCKEY Conn College 3 ECSU 2 MANSFIELD — Alex Kallgren scored her team-leading ninth goal but the Warriors (7-5) fell to their intrastate rivals. VOLLEYBALL WCSU 3 Page 2 of 2 - ECSU 0 DANBURY — Adrianna Mihalek had 10 kills and Fitch alum Ashley Adams added five kills, but the Warriors (10-11, 2-2 Little East) were swept, 25-21, 25-22, 25-11. By The Bulletin
